title: Leveraging High-Resolution Features for Improved Deep Hashing-based Image Retrieval
abstract: arXiv:2403.13747v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Deep hashing techniques have emerged as the predominant approach for efficient image retrieval. Traditionally, these methods utilize pre-trained convolutional neural networks (CNNs) such as AlexNet and VGG-16 as feature extractors. However, the increasing complexity of datasets poses challenges for these backbone architectures in capturing meaningful features essential for effective image retrieval. In this study, we explore the efficacy of employing high-resolution features learned through state-of-the-art techniques for image retrieval tasks. Specifically, we propose a novel methodology that utilizes High-Resolution Networks (HRNets) as the backbone for the deep hashing task, termed High-Resolution Hashing Network (HHNet). Our approach demonstrates superior performance compared to existing methods across all tested benchmark datasets, including CIFAR-10, NUS-WIDE, MS COCO, and ImageNet. translated_title: 利用高分辨率特征改进基于深度哈希的图像检索
translated_abstract: 深度哈希技术已经成为高效图像检索的主要方法。本研究探讨了利用高分辨率特征进行图像检索任务的有效性，并提出了一种利用高分辨率网络（HRNets）作为深度哈希任务骨干的新方法，称为高分辨率哈希网络（HHNet）。我们的方法相较于现有方法在各个基准数据集（包括CIFAR-10，NUS-WIDE，MS COCO和ImageNet）上表现出显著的优越性能。
tldr: 探索利用高分辨率特征进行图像检索，提出了一种利用High-Resolution Networks作为骨干的深度哈希网络（HHNet），在各个基准数据集上表现出优越性能。
en_tdlr: Investigating the use of high-resolution features for image retrieval, proposing a deep hashing network (HHNet) utilizing High-Resolution Networks as backbone, demonstrating superior performance on benchmark datasets.
